variable.name: bcr_patient_barcode
variable.description: TCGA patient identifier

variable.name: disease_study
variable.description: TCGA study code

variable.name: tumor_colorectal_location_anatomic_site
variable.description: Text term to describe the anatomic site(s) of colorectal cancer in an individual.

variable.name: age_at_initial_pathologic_diagnosis
variable.description: Age of subject when first diagnosed

variable.name: days_to_death
variable.description: Number of days between date of initial pathologic diagnosis and date of death

variable.name: days_to_last_followup
variable.description: Number of days between date of initial pathologic diagnosis and date of last clinical exam

variable.name: days_to_last_known_alive
variable.description: Number of days between date of initial pathologic diagnosis and date of the last reported positive vital status

variable.name: distant_metastasis_pathologic_spread
variable.description: Code of pathological M (metastasis) to define the absence or presence of distant spread or metastases to locations via vascular channels or lymphatics beyond the regional lymph nodes (N), using criteria established by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC).(public CDE id 3045439)

variable.name: gender
variable.description: Gender of an individual(public CDE id 2200604)

variable.name: histological_type
variable.description: Text term for the structural pattern of cancer cells used to define a microscopic diagnosis.(public CDE id 3081934)

variable.name: history_of_colon_polyps
variable.description: Yes/No indicator to describe if the subject had a previous history of colon polyps as noted in the history/physical or previous endoscopic report (s).(public CDE id 3107197)

variable.name: icd_o_3_histology
variable.description: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms. The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs. In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains. A system of numbered categories for representation of data.(public CDE id 3226275)

variable.name: icd_o_3_site
variable.description: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms. The description of an anatomical region or of a body part. Named locations of, or within, the body. A system of numbered categories for representation of data.(public CDE id 3226281)

variable.name: lymphatic_invasion_present
variable.description: Text indicator to signify the presence of lymphatic invasion

variable.name: lymphnode_pathologic_spread
variable.description: Code of pathological N (Nodal) to define the absence or presence and extent of cancer in the regional draining lymph nodes (N) using criteria established by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC).(public CDE id 3065858)

variable.name: lymphnodes_examined
variable.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator whether a lymph node assessment was performed at the primary presentation of disease.(public CDE id 2200396)

variable.name: number_of_first_degree_relatives_with_cancer_diagnosis
variable.description: Numeric value to represent the number of first degree relatives (parent, sibling and /or child) associated with a diagnoisis of cancer.(public CDE id 3107205)

variable.name: number_of_lymphnodes_examined
variable.description: The total number of lymph nodes removed and pathologically assessed for disease.(public CDE id 3)

variable.name: number_of_lymphnodes_positive_by_he
variable.description: Numeric value to signify the count of positive lymph nodes identified through hematoxylin and eosin (H&E) staining light microscopy.(public CDE id 3086388)

variable.name: person_neoplasm_cancer_status
variable.description: The state or condition of an individual's neoplasm at a particular point in time. [Manually-curated](public CDE id 2759550)

variable.name: preoperative_pretreatment_cea_level
variable.description: Numeric value of the Carcinoembryonic antigen or CEA at the time before surgery. [Manually-curated](public CDE id 2716510)

variable.name: primary_tumor_pathologic_spread
variable.description: Code of pathological T (primary tumor) to define the size or contiguous extension of the primary tumor (T), using staging criteria from the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC).(public CDE id 3045435)

variable.name: prior_diagnosis
variable.description: The yes/no indicator to identify patient/participants who were diagnosed with another cancer prior to study entry.(public CDE id 61396)

variable.name: residual_tumor
variable.description: Text terms to describe the status of a tissue margin following surgical resection.(public CDE id 2608702)

variable.name: synchronous_colon_cancer_present
variable.description: The yes/no indicator whether synchronous colon cancer is present.(public CDE id 2185953)

variable.name: tumor_stage
variable.description: Classification assigned to a malignancy which allows for the grouping of similar cancer types based on the extent of disease in the primary tumor (T), regional lymph nodes (N), and metastatic sites (M), using criteria from the American Joint Committee on Cancer, or AJCC, staging criteria.(public CDE id 3065862)

variable.name: vascular_invasion_present
variable.description: Text indicator to signify the presence of vascular invasion at the time of surgery for a cancer patient.(public CDE id 3028360)

variable.name: vital_status
variable.description: Text summary level description of patient/participant survival status.(public CDE id 2939553)
